phrase.item: A foolish boy
Once upon a time there was a foolish boy.
One day he went to collect manure.
Then he found a needle.
He put it in his wooden backpack and came [home].
He went home and told his mother, "Hey mother, I found a needle and put it in my backpack. It has fallen from there."
His mother told him, "Hey you foolish donkey, you're supposed to pin the needle on your collar."
The next morning the boy went to collect manure again.
He found a pet (dog) and he pressed him on his collar and the dog died.
He returned home and said, "Hey mother, I found a pet.
Then I pressed it on my collar and suddenly it died."
His mother told him, "Hey foolish donkey, you're supposed to make the pet follow you and call it by saying bo-bo (way of calling a dog).
It could guard our house."
Next day he went again to collect wood and he found a rabbit.
He tried to make it follow him and called 'bo-bo' and the rabbit ran away.
He came home and said, "Hey mother, I found a rabbit.
I put it behind me and called 'bo-bo' but it ran away."
His mother said, "Hey foolish donkey, you're supposed to break the rabbit's legs and bring it home to make kebabs."
The next day he went and [saw] bull-herders with their bulls standing
and he broke one of the bull's legs.
The bull-herder hit him.
He came home and said, "Hey mother, I went and [saw] that the bull-herders were drinking tea.
I broke their bull's leg
and they hit me."
His mother said, "Hey foolish donkey, you're supposed to tell them 'gain power for work' (refers to enjoy the moment while working)."
Next day he went and [saw] that someone had died and everybody was crying.
He suddenly entered the house and said, "Get power of work."
The men took him out of the house.
He returned home and told his mother, "I went to a place where [people] were crying,
I told them 'gain power for work' but they took me out [of the house]."
His mother replied to him, "Hey, foolish donkey, you're supposed to cry with them."
The next day he left again.
There was a wedding somewhere, he entered the house crying.
They took him out of the house.
He came and told his mother, "Hey dear mother, I went to the wedding and from the entrance I cried loudly [but] they took me out."
His mother said, "Hey foolish donkey, at a wedding you're suppesed to dance and be happy."
Then the boy said, "Make my wedding as well, I want to have a wife".
His mother thought that nobody is going to marry this foolish donkey.
She went outside and dressed a shovel in a dress, put a kerchief on it's face and made it stand up.
She entered the [house] and said, "Hey son, your wife is outside."
He came outside happily, he stepped in the handle of the shovel and he got hit by shovel in the middle of his head.
He cried and came inside the house and said, "Hey mother, my wife hit me."
His mother said, "She might run away," and she went outside threw the shovel on the roof and the dress in the corner.
She entered the [house] and said, "Hey son, your wife has gone."
